author: lpanchot
title: Clarity DAO Incubator
description: There is a high technical barrier to entry to make and manage DAOs on Cardano currently.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal fits well with the objectives of the challenge, by promoting a way that users and communities without any programming knowledge can create a decentralized autonomous organization, or DAO, in a simple and practical way, thus being able to drastically increase the diversity and quantity of Dapps present in the cardano ecosystem, consequently also being able to increase the influence, presence and adoption of Dapps that revolve around the cardano ecosystem, which would end up bringing many new users to cardano. As problems, in addition to those already addressed by the authors of the proposal, which would be the ability to find creators and communities that want to become DAOs, which in turn can be solved with a good marketing campaign and a quality final product that generates recommendations. among users, helping to increase its adoption among cardano users, there is also the problem of how close to other options on the market such as Aragon and DAOstack Alchemy, the final product will be, but of course this is a problem more aimed at users of outside the ecosystem itself, which in turn, in addition to not being one of the main objectives of the campaign, will also depend on how good the final product will be, and how close it comes to the products already found on the market, mentioned above. In this way, the project, in addition to being able to generate a great impact on the Cardano ecosystem, having problems that can be solved within the field of realism, and also due to the lack of other similar products within the Cardano ecosystem, makes the proposal well in line with the objectives. of the challenge, and with a good chance of succeeding.
f6_assessments.q1:
At first glance, it seems that the requested funding of 70K USD is way above what is expected by the challenge guidelines, considering that the team only consists of two members, Logan Panchot, and Justin Schreiner, but in reality, only 20K USD will be destined for the development of Dapp, and the other 50K USD will be divided among the other users who made themselves available to be part of this project as the first developers to use this DAO tooling platform that works tied to the Cardano ecosystem, in addition, as the maximum number of users cannot exceed 10, a minimum of 5K USD will be made available to each of these developers in order to facilitate and accelerate their progress, which in the end ends up being a justifiable cost for the way in which the investment received will be used.

And about the qualification of the team involved, unfortunately little is made available, the most useful qualification informed for the development of the proposal is the fact that it is presented on Justin Schreiner's linkedin page (https://www.linkedin.com/in/ justinschreiner/), that he has experience with software development, participating in several IT projects with SQL and ERL software for Software Engineer Intern(https://www.linkedin.com/company/young-innovations/). Which, on the one hand, is good because it demonstrates that at least someone on the team has experience in software development, on the other hand, it means that the entire program development process will be in the hands of a single person.

Regarding the planning, although simple, it is effective, with 4 periods and intervals of the production process, being the first and second month, and two intervals from 2 to 6 and from 6 to 12 months, and even with this simplicity, I believe that be enough.
f6_assessments.q2: In terms of monitoring, fortunately for community members who choose to be part of the first group of developers to use the product proposed by the project, biweekly meetings will be made available, so that they can give their feedback and expose their progress so far. And for the rest of the community, a space will be made available on twitter to discuss different issues related to the project, but there is no planning or frequency for these meetings, and also because of the limitations of the space itself, if there is only one of the project's members, there will be a maximum of 12 spots left for the rest of the community to participate, which ends up limiting the extent of contact at these meetings. In summary, for the first developers of the platform who have enlisted in the project, the contact will apparently be relatively good, and for the community, not so much.

f6_assessments.q0:
The challenge is to build dApps for registries to be used at the national lever. DAOs and DAO tooling are are focused on much smaller groups. 

The proposal argues that the project will promote peaceful and more workable communities. This is important in nation building, but not the focus of this challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team is experienced and organized. they have a clear plan of what they want to do and a reasonable timeline. 

The plan may be underestimating the amount of money they need for staff salaries. They may also be overly optimistic about working with 10 DAOs in the first round. Each project may be more expensive than expected; both in terms of money and time needed.
f6_assessments.q2:
Yes. The assessment points are clear and well defined. The timeline is derived from experience working on the first phase of this. This experience is valuable in predicting future work. 

The regular and frequent meetings will encourage accountability.

f6_assessments.q0:
CA assessment based on 30 years experience in software development, running several NFP orgs, founding a gaming experience  business and now working with a colab team on Cardano proposals. (Not in misc).
So first, I have to say well done for bringing DAO tooling to Cardano. I agree with your statement you are first. Our group has been looking at other solutions like Aragon, Colony & Seeds. However despite being potential users of your tooling this review will be unbiased and based on CA assessment guidelines. No favouritism. 
First I can see why this is submitted into Misc as other categories that almost fit, are a bit too narrow in focus and may not allow this proposal. It's very clear what the challenge is to be solved and how it will be of benefit to the ecosystem, especially challenge teams who may need to distribute funding among themselves. It's also scalable as is can be used by anyone, outside of catalyst teams and isn't tied to a specific geo-region or market segment.
f6_assessments.q1: The team have provide linked in profile links and explained their link with MLabs for chain development work. This gives confidence the team have skills and resources able to do the work. It's initially surprising that an incubator is required to get teams to participate setting up a DAO, but it's understandable given the tooling is not ready yet and so help with development and testing is required - which takes time and effort, so offering a reward for this makes sense. A maximum of $5,000 per DAO seems a reasonable amount. The timescales for creating the tools seem fair and not too aggressive to reduce the chance of slippage. The attached whitepaper provide sufficient technical information to know what is actually being developed as part of the toolset. Lastly key risk identified not getting enough teams to participate is something I've seen the Clarity folks trying to resolve already having seen them run several break outs at townhall introducing their proposal to Catalyst community many of who will be operating on DAO principles if not formally set up yet.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal includes solid roadmap and what success looks like. Whilst there are public meetings and distribution of grants is to 3rd parties - it would be nice to see where and how these are going to be made auditable by the wider catalyst community. E.g. what happens to unspent funds? Whilst one can assume the DAOs will be paid via ADA and so visible on the blockchain, and the meeting and documentation will be made public somewhere like a gitbook or the website, it would be nice to know this explicitly rather than having to assume it. Hence this has only been given 4 stars.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal to offer a DAO incubator program to existing Cardano Communities addresses the technical barriers to DAO creation and management on Cardano. The proposal will provide access to a suite of primitive DAO tools that will allow creators and the community on Cardano to build new, viable DAOs on-chain. This proposal will be more detailed and complete if it describes more clearly the solution to incentivize creators/communities to participate in the incubator, the criteria for selecting projects for collaboration, and how to community can evaluate the effectiveness of the projects participating in the incubator as appropriate and bring value to the ecosystem. If the proposed team can clarify the above issue, this proposal will be more complete.
f6_assessments.q1: The main member of the team consists of 2 people with the experience and capacity to implement this proposal. In addition, some of the original DAO toolkits are ready, some are in development, indicating that the project has been and is being implemented. The proposal provides a 12-month roadmap with specific goals for 1 month, 2 months, 6 months, and 12 months, but does not clearly describe the implementation solution to accomplish the set goals. The budget given is 70000$ which is a big amount for a team of two, however, most of the budget is allocated to the incubator participants (50000$) for them to continue to grow; it would be better to propose budget allocation according to the efficiency, impact value of each project participating in the incubator instead of dividing it equally and adding a budget plan in case the number of people participating in the incubator is more than expected.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal provides a 12-month implementation roadmap, a concise plan with results to be achieved, and a timeline to complete the work. The success of the project is also described with specific metrics: there are 10 existing Cardano communities using the tool within the first month, and after the end of the roadmap, all the members of the incubator running on-chain DAOs using the Clarity protocol. With the proposed information provided, the community can easily evaluate the performance of the project.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal selects the DAO engine as the Dapp support platform for the Cardano community.
With more than a year of experience in building and developing the community, following the success of Fund7, this proposal is an expanded version to provide better management tools, support for the development of the community Cardano coins.

This proposal is a great constructive idea, bringing great value to the community. With effective and prepared solutions, they have solved the challenges with the acceptance of the community.
With products ready to go into the community, and some in development. The program team has created a highly interactive community effect around the development of these DAO tools. Additionally, they empower the creators and community on Cardano to self-manage and interact with the Daos. Contribute to building a thriving community.

The proponent has given the predetermined risks, and at the same time has a ready-made solution. Importantly, I see confidence in your team, and you are always there to support and help the community.
This is great for your community! If the project is successful, you always have the initiative to solve the problems that arise.
f6_assessments.q1: Have a detailed plan, present a specific implementation timeline for each goal. This is great, everything is ready to prepare for the success of the project. The Total Requested Proposed Budget is $70,000, divided into two parts, which: + $50,000: Equally distributed among incubators + 20,000 USD: Team salary I find the given budget to be reasonable, with a clear and reasonable allocation explanation. I agree with this suggestion. Professional working team, with clear contracts, division of work, and responsibility. The main team is Panchot, Justin Schreiner (Their information can be easily found on LinkedIn), and the group of people in the incubator. I'm quite impressed with Logan Panchot. He is an enterprising Stanford University Alumnus: "Start a business because the best way to predict the future is to create it" What is worth learning in building your team is a matter of building relationships, turning relationships into a magnet to attract customers and partners of goodwill.
f6_assessments.q2:
There are specific metrics, a plan to link action goals, and a clear timeline.
This shows preparedness, experience, and prior preparation.
If this project is successful, I also look forward to your next project. . .

The project has clearly defined success, has a preparation and an action plan, ready to support and help the communities and creators in the Cardano ecosystem from idea to on-chain DAO operation.

With what you guys are trying and achieving, I hope you promote more, to launch products that best serve the community. . .

Project "Clear DAO Incubator" - This is an expansion project that the team follows from the success of Fund7. I hope in this topic, your Team will be funded in this round, to have the motivation to continue to create valuable products to help the Cardano community grow.

f6_assessments.q0: Creating a tool that would make creating DAOs could be beneficial to the blockchain. However, I do worry about bloat on the chain if a large number of these projects decide to stop building simply because of lack of funding. I feel as if you are splitting your Incubator funds too thin to incentivize people to finish their projects.
f6_assessments.q1: You only have one team member listed here, and then generalize the "incubators" very broadly. It worries me that these funds will not be placed where they need to be in order to further our ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q2: Would like to see a more complete breakdown of goals and ideas for the future. Other than that critique, you guys touched on everything that should be included for auditing a proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: I give this proposal a 5 star rating due to the fact that the proposers have clearly spelt out measurable solutions to address the challenge. The proposers truly understand the situation at had and as such have outlined requisite measures to address it.
f6_assessments.q1:
This proposal is highly likely to be implemented successfully due to the fact that the proposers are collaborating with a reliable team of experts, MLabs to successfully implement the proposal. 

The level of experience of the Team is quite assuring coupled with the well thought plan to execute this proposal, it is without doubt that the proposal will be implemented. 
I therefore give it a 5 star rating.
f6_assessments.q2:
The budget provided by the proposers did indicate the grand total amount needed to execute the proposal.  The budget had two figures 50,000 and 20,000. Even though the budget clearly showed how the 50,000 will be utilized, it didn't really outline how the 20,000 will be used. 

That being said, taking into account that the proposers have recieved previous approval  for funding it is obvious they will use the funds judiciously. 
I therefore give it a 4 star rating.

f6_assessments.q0: It's wonderful to know that some of your products, NFT Minting service, and CC Bot, were already completed. I would like to say that you have proposed a relatively clear solution, which includes specific completion time for other products. Besides, I think it would be a great idea if you can tell more about the benefits that incubator participants will receive after your on-chain DAO tooling is released so that they can be attracted and use your products. In addition, your application’s output synchronizes to that of the challenge when you say your solution will help increase the number of Carnado communities and lower the barrier to entry for users to create, manage, and interact with DAOs. Finally, in my mind, your mentioned difficulties are realistic and their solutions are believed to be effective.
f6_assessments.q1: Overall, your project provides an acceptable timeline and plan for delivering the solution and a good budget breakdown. However, in order to be more specific, I recommend you list a more detailed budget allocation, if possible, such as how much you will need to pay your team members, to build product iterations, operate incubator, recruit incubator, and incubator marketing. Also, from my point of view, supplementing more information to the profiles of your team members will be a good option to attract investors in the fund-raising round. You can add their experiences and achievements in this field into the list. And it would be better if you can name the core staff of Clear Contracts and MLabs associated with the highlight points in their profiles.
f6_assessments.q2: Really amazing! Your team has given explicit roadmap, milestones, including goals and subgoals, which express your true interest in this challenge. The completion time corresponding to every result is mentioned properly, and your definition of success regarding this project amazes me because of its conciseness and convincingness. Furthermore, I can feel your great enthusiasm in this challenge more obviously when you raise all main and secondary targets.

f6_assessments.q0: In general, your IMPACT section covers all the content that the proposal needs. In particular, the solution description is very well explained. I was also able to see the impact the project had on Cardano through your presentation. At the end of this section, risk is also mentioned and I appreciate your solution to reduce risk.
f6_assessments.q1: Your roadmap is organized by month and the tasks in each stage are also clearly listed. Through the detailed budget analysis you mentioned, I find it quite reasonable and acceptable. Your team is also introduced 2 main members and intends to include other members of the incubator. Overall, in my opinion, your presentation is pretty good and this project is feasible.
f6_assessments.q2: The goals for each phase have been mentioned, besides, the project is also guaranteed to be regularly reported and updated on progress. I greatly appreciate you hearing and gathering ideas from the incubator participants and the community. In the description of the success, I can see the value that the project brings to the community and Cardano.

f6_assessments.q0:
As proposer mentioned there is technical barrier to entry to make and manage DAOs on Cardano currently. 
This incubation program helps in  having more clarity, with the help of bot which will definitely encourage to make a way and manage towards DAO's on Cardano for current and future propose hence this proposal effectively addressed the challenge
f6_assessments.q1:
This plan has chances of being successful since the founders and co founders are been here for a time.
The proposer even have data ready for NFT mining and cc bots , the proposer has clean targets for 12 months
The only issue can be seen here is the time duration is very long ,Other than experience and presented plan is great which which has very high chances of success
f6_assessments.q2:
Definitely, there is a clean information and a proper goal , Audit has mentioned mentioned about the step by step progress of the company , here proposer has also mentioned working to communities who can utilize their products which will be encourage different communities to go with cardano
The proposer has creatively mentioned how incubator will be successful one.
hence the info provided  is sufficient to audit the progress for successful proposer

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal addresses the challenge as it aims to bring an incubator program to existing Cardano Communities. In particular, the team will provide a suite of primitive DAO tooling products, some of which are already available.
f6_assessments.q1:
The first checkpoint of the timeline seems a bit underestimated, as collecting all the 10 DAOs in 1 month might not be feasible.
The team has been already funded for Fund 7, and this is a project continuation. 
The bi weekly meeting will track progress of the (max) 10 DAOs which will join the incubator.
The team member provided their reference, website link and proved partnership with MLabs. These elements lead to think that this proposal will reach completion within the timeline proposed. 
The requested budget of 70000 USD seems adequate to cover all expenses listed, starting from the fair distribution of 5000 USD to each DAOs joining the project.
f6_assessments.q2:
Timeline is will outlined. I would break down the 20000 USD budget to see the allocation for marketing, because as stated above  the major pain point will be to convince people transforming their project into a DAO, or create a new DAO.
The team already provided the link to the Clear contracts platform and the link to the previous challenge, which contains a tutorial on how a smart contract would be available on the clearcontracts.io website

f6_assessments.q0: The governance of the DAO network determines whether the technology platform is on the right path of decentralization to be ready for network expansion and community service. DAO governance makes resources linked together to maximize the power of the entire network. Creating a DAO governance in a network is extremely important, although not simple, because it is the part that balances the interests and responsibilities of each department in an organization. This idea needs to be implemented, although I have not fully envisioned what the DAO you are building will be like, serving the community, but I hope it will become a model for future projects. learn and reduce DAO creative investment time.
f6_assessments.q1: The working group is calling for the first DAO cohort open to all communities. I think this is a practical and important step that accelerates the implementation and collection of innovative ideas and contributes to faster building of DAO governance for future project platforms. The project has the mentorship of Mlab - a group with a lot of experience and a certain voice in the cardano community that ensures the project is taken more seriously.
f6_assessments.q2: A project related to DAO administration is like turning ideas into lines of code, so it is not easy to build a DAO system because it involves group interests and the use of resources in an organization or a foundational technology. To check the progress we need to ask the team that built this DAO to describe in detail the goals that have been achieved, and at the same time make the code public and encourage the community to participate to benefit from the project. That's the best way to help ideas like this go deep into the community. Thereby we can measure the results of the project.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal meets the challenge as it would: "increase efficiency, transparency, and stakeholder engagement as well as expand the business to new areas." 

It would provide a bridge to DAO creation to non-technical/low-technical organizers. By reducing the technical requirements of organizing a DAO, this proposal would support greater proliferation.
f6_assessments.q1:
It is not entirely clear that a templated DAO structure is currently technically possible. 

While it is possible to design a DAO, there are open questions as to the security, governance technicalities, longevity, centralization, and "edge" cases. The proposal itself introduces the necessity of defined arbitrators early in the process: 
" 3. Escrow Service (2ish month timeline):
           Control Escrow agreements on Cardano using manual user input to verify completion of agreements.
           Securely transfer Cardano Native Assets.
          Assign an arbitrator to fairly resolve disputes on-chain."

The offer of discrete tooling mitigates some of this complexity, but far from all. 

The team does not seem to have successfully built a widely heralded DAO, therefore it is not clear that they are qualified to lead a incubator for effective DAO creation.
f6_assessments.q2:
the timeline of this project is effectively, to attract customers to the incubator, pay them incentives, onboard them on to as-yet-uncreated DAO Tooling. This makes the in-progress and performance sensing impossible.

How will the community know if the DAO tooling they have invested in is on target? Ahead of schedule? behind?

The proposal does not lay out independently verifiable metrics and milestones. Therefore, the gates discussed are insufficient to audit progress and likelihood of success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
DAO's in Cardano are emerging at an accelerated pace. These vehicles will allow many like-minded people to pool their talents and resources to achieve exponential results, from things as obvious as increasing their wealth, to changing some people's lives through collaboration.
Currently most DAO's operate through bots on Discord and everyone is doing their best to define the rules that can make the organization work better. 
It is necessary to provide the community with tools that allow to organize a DAO in a fast and efficient way, taking in the best practices in the rules and bylaws, but also in the smart contracts and the resources that will enable them to work properly, so more Dapps can be integrated as interoperability aproaches fast.
I find this initiative of vital importance to propel the growth of the ecosystem. We already have the hardest thing to achieve; a good, honest and collaborative community. Let's give the network the tools necessary for the DAO's in Cardano to move at the pace the world needs to be changed.
I truly believe this proposal adresses these needs and can help fulfill them.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has organized a plan with concrete actions to involve DAOs already formed in the Cardano ecosystem, and go through the maturation process together with them.
A series of tools have been previously developed to be made available for this challenge, which will undoubtedly help to achieve the expected results.
The team has extensive experience both on the side of Clear Contracts and Mlabs, they are companies that already have prestige within the community. It is positive to know that this team has been previously funded by the Catalyst project with an initiative directly related to the topic we are dealing with.
The budget seeks to be allocated mostly to the DAOs that will participate in the incubation process, and almost a third will be allocated to the necessary iterations to perfect the best tools that a DAO must have for its formation.
I consider that the feasibility of carrying out this objective is high, and if it is founded, I hope that its results will be widely disseminated.
f6_assessments.q2:
I believe that the measurement objectives have been clearly outlined and the bi-weekly meetings will be an excellent tool to measure the progress that each of the DAOs in the incubation process will achieve in the coming months.
On the other hand, although I consider it positive that twitter spaces are maintained with the community, I would like there to be some more formal reporting method, especially towards the Catalyst evaluation community, such as a development blog or video blog, or even the presence in one of the townhalls to talk about the project.
After all these considerations, I believe that the results evaluated will clearly show how users benefit from this exercise of learning and developing best practices and taking advantage of the best resources.

solution: Provide an incubation program to onboard initial DAOs onto our Dapp enabled DAO tooling platform.
experience: My cofounder and I have been building on Cardano for about a year now. After thinking about what the community needs to flourish, we settled on DAO tooling. We recently partnered with MLabs to build Clarity Protocol, an open source DAO tooling smart contract library protocol.
